column4: I'd like to make a bash script that opens multiple terminal windows. Is this possible?
but you have to type in your password myrl
how do you open multiple tabs in the same terminal window when writing a bash script?
If your writing a bash script you can use a plain text editor if you like.
but what is the command to start  a new tab?
I meant in a bash script
umm? do I put a slash before that or anything?
I can just as easily tell smartasses to go help themselves.
I just told you how. If you need more details "man gnome-terminal".
I'm gonna have to report/ignore you if you continue with the insults
And yes you do put a - before the ummm.
how do you make the new commands appear in the new tab that is opened in the way you showed me?
